executive_summary: The Children's Book Publishing industry has contended with conflicting trends and the broader stagnation of the book publishing industry. Parents still value children's literacy despite digital alternatives, which has helped partially shield the industry from the external solid competition these digital alternatives have created. The rise of blockbuster young adult fiction and the subsequent hype from their movies has made a boom-and-bust cycle, with increases in revenue in years with significant releases often followed by declines.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry Expected to Enjoy Sustained Marginal Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry is expected to enjoy sustained marginal growth in the coming years. High per capita disposable income levels and a boost in children nine and younger will conflate to strengthen downstream demand. Industry enterprises will continue to rely on the confluence power of books and movie hits to generate revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Gains Countered by Challenges in Digital Formats
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Gains in per capita personal disposable income and consumer spending were countered by the challenges in developing book applications for mobile devices, inconsistent growth in the e-book market and declining sales at brick-and-mortar bookstores.

Although parents typically regard their children's literacy as instrumental to their early development, the industry has still contended with increasing competition for leisure time among digital alternatives, such as TV and online content.
During the pandemic, parents needed additional entertainment to keep their children occupied during stay-at-home orders, resulting in solid industry product sales despite the economic downturn.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Although continued growth in the K-12 demographic will stimulate spending on children's books, the industry will continue to contend with challenges.
Profit will remain pressured as moderate hikes in the price of paper and increased publishing costs of interactive e-books balances revenue gains and continued labor cost declines.

Children's book publishing companies will continue to invest in new digital formats and create interactive versions of e-books to justify higher prices. The accessibility of tablets contributes to e-books' popularity by providing a way for books to be stored and accessed.
The budding trend of book adaptations released through streaming services may help boost this industry segment.
Young adult books and their respective multi-media adaptations are expected to continue to climb in popularity for older age groups.

industry_definition: This industry designs, edits and markets books for children aged 17 and under, including coloring and picture books. It does include e-books, but excludes online-only publishers and authors, as well as textbook publishing.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Per capita disposable income
threats: Low Outlier Growth - Price of paper

key_trends: Publishers compete to attract best-selling authors and invest in long-term contracts with these authors to guarantee rights to their works. Many major publishing houses are investing in digital technology, enabling them to interact with their target markets directly.
External threats have increasingly penetrated Children's book publishing because the internet has established a vast market for reselling used and new children's books.

The market for children's books has been increasingly pressured by alternative forms of youth media. E-books have struggled to find as solid a foothold in this industry as they do in the broader book publishing world.
Children's book publishers have experienced an influx of popularity for young adult books. Many publishers desperately seek out the rights for these titles given their increased sales.

market_segmentation.segment_description: In-store purchases, which large bookstores once dominated, have plummeted with the rise of online shopping.
The retail channel (often called the 'trade' channel within the industry) represents children's brick-and-mortar and online sales.
School-based sales are generated from school book clubs and fairs.

products_and_services.product_description: Children's and Young Adult fiction books are typically released in hardback versions first.
Despite being sold at a lower price, paperback versions of children's book are typically more widely sold.
E-book sales have boomed in recent years as the rise of social media and smartphone technology has shifted social attitudes away from analog media consumption.
Board books are printed on thick paperboard for the cover and the interior pages.

tier_2_suppliers: Performers & Creative Artists in the US
Dye & Pigment Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_buyers: Book, Magazine & Newspaper Wholesaling in the US
Orphanages & Group Homes in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Children's books are a discretionary household expenditure; children read books for pleasure or educational purposes.
As the US population increases, so does the market for children's book publishers.

business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic region accounts for the most prominent share of all industry business locations in the nation.
The Southeast's dense population makes it a valuable region for publishers.
The West is the second largest region, with a marginally smaller share of industry establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The industry is subject to waste management, antitrust, fair pricing, trademark, and copyright regulations.
The publishing and printing sectors have been lobbying for changes to CPSIA since the law was enacted.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Prospective publishers will have to contend with waste management, antitrust, fair pricing, trademark and copyright regulations.
The significant barriers for the Children's Book Publishing industry include the costs.
Leading publishers often dominate shelf space in retail stores.
Book publishing is a labor-intensive production process.

basis_points.basis_description: Publishers compete to attract best-selling authors.
Many major publishing houses are investing in digital technology.
External threats have increasingly penetrated Children's book publishing.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Two prominent enterprises control significant share
concentration_points.concentration_description: The Children's Book Publishing industry is characterized by a moderate concentration level.
Concentration has been increasing as major book publishers dedicate more resources.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Costs Will Depress as E-Books Grow in Popularity
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Regular purchases include content, paper, ink, printing equipment and packaging materials.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profitability Suffers as Paper Prices Soar
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: A hike in the price of paper has largely balanced out increased technological efficiencies.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: WAGE COSTS EXPAND AS PROMINENT ENTERPRISES EXTEND THEIR REACH
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In the coming years, average profit will stabilize somewhat.
Book publishing is a labor-intensive production process.
CONTINUED IMPROVEMENTS IN PRINTING PROCESSES WILL REDUCE EMPLOYEES AND TIME COSTS.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Book publishing is a labor-intensive production process
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: A high degree of creativity is required.

volatility_points.volatility_title: BLOCKBUSTER YOUNG ADULT LITERATURE CAN PROVIDE A SIGNIFICANT BOOST TO REVENUE
volatility_points.volatility_description: Sales of blockbuster hits can generate significant spikes.

volatility_points.volatility_title: PUBLISHERS RELY ON STEADY DEMAND FROM SCHOOLS TO BUOY THE INDUSTRY
volatility_points.volatility_description: Sales of books from other markets demonstrate less volatility.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Continued improvements in printing processes will reduce the employees and time costs
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Automation in printing has enabled continuous monitoring.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: E-books continue to innovate on traditional children's book publishing
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: As e-reader devices debuted, publishers have had to adapt.

FAQs.question: How have changes in consumers' electronic usage habits changed your operations?
FAQs.answer: Publishers have had to incorporate some type of e-book operation to remain competitive.

FAQs.question: How has the shift toward conducting business online affected demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: The move toward online purchasing of both physical and digital books has given companies strength.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to rising wages in recent years?
FAQs.answer: Wages are falling with the rise of e-book publishing.

FAQs.question: How has technology change affected the cost of serving your customers?
FAQs.answer: E-book publishing requires no paper, which reduces the cost of production.

FAQs.question: Is your company leveraging digital technologies internally to increase your company's efficiency?
FAQs.answer: Software for plagiarism detection and editing have become more advanced in recent years.

FAQs.question: Has your company been able to keep up with rapidly changing digital interfaces?
FAQs.answer: Some companies have done more than others.

FAQs.question: Are you or your competitors facing scrutiny from antitrust litigation?
FAQs.answer: Recent rulings have set a precedent for the industry.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: Publishers closely work with trade associations to promote their content.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Companies that earn more money from their e-book segments generate higher profit margins.

FAQs.question: Do you have any challenges with customers paying on time?
